content: I presume this is a self-hosted website and the new one will be also. If true, (and if you set up a domain for the club) the domain name for the account can be switched to the new one and keep the same email address. The messages (assuming IMAP) will need to be downloaded and copied to new server. To do that, click File>offline>download to ensure you get all the message content, not just the headers. If you need more detail, let me know.
creator: davidsk

content:
For those of us on Windows 7, it seems the latest version we're allowed to download is ver 115. It's not what I'd call "fully hanged" but it hangs constantly whenever it needs to send or receive emails. Lots of people have reported this and I've spent days (on the Troubleshooting forum) asking if it's possible to roll back to a version which previously worked - but no-one seems interested.

[Edit...] Two days ago an urgent update got released for ver 115 (115.14.0). Not only did it not fix the problem but there's now a new problem whereby it doesn't mark emails as downloaded on the upstream server. So the same emails keep getting downloaded again and again :-(

Some rollback instructions would be very useful.
creator: john391

content: We are using Windows 11 64bit OS & we are updated Thunderbird 12.8 version and after update only we are facing this issue
creator: siddu.ec30

content:
Here are the steps: - exit thunderbird - this is very IMPORTANT. otherwise, the backup will be incomplete - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to the USB stick. (one way to do this is to 

  - on desktop, enter  %appdata% in the search bar and click enter. that should bring up the appdata folder or possibly the appdata\roaming folder. There, highlight and rightclick the 'Thunderbird' folder and copy to the USB stick. )

If you ever need to restore, just be sure Thunderbird is not running and place the backed-up Thunderbird folder back where you copied it from,
creator: davidsk

creator: rosgold

content:
That looks right. Let's take it to a deeper level now. - start windows file explorer, click 'View' and then click 'show' and tick 'filename extensions' - that is important to see everything. For example, if you now look at your backup, you should see 'profiles.ini', not just 'profiles' - if you open profiles.ini with notepad, you will see it has the name of the active profile. - close that and open the profiles folder and you will see the profile with that name. That is backup of your profile. - if you open that folder, you will see a folder called 'Mail' and one called 'imapmail'. Those are the repositories for accounts.'S\ SO, if you have a POP account, click the Mail folder and you will see your account name there. If you click the accountname, you will see your message folders, such as inbox, inbox.msf, and sent and sent.msf, etc. (The .msf files are the index files and the other files contain the messages.) - If you have an local folders, they are stored in Mail\Local Folders, so you can view them there.

If you need to restore the profile, - first, thunderbird must already be installed, so install if necessary, but EXIT it. Thunderbird cannot be running when restoring a profile. - then, in windows file explorer, copy the backed-up Thunderbird folder to overlay the on that is there at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming.

I suggest doing the backup weekly to minimize the possibily of losing messages, but monthly at minimum.
creator: davidsk

content: Wow, Thank you so much. I can now see the emails. Your instructions were so good and very easy to follow Thank you so much once again. I will keep these notes for future reference.
creator: rosgold

content:
Ovviamente puoi utilizzare anche le vecchie versioni, ma devi tenere conto che non vengono più aggiornate ne nelle funzioni ne per quanto riguarda la sicurezza.

Tutte le vecchie versioni di Firefox le trovi qui -> http://archive.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/

Quelle di Thunderbird sono qui -> http://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/

In entrami i casi scegli prima la versione che ti interessa, poi il sistema operativo ed infine la lingua italiana (it). Quindi scarica il programma di installazione

content: If you forgot password, you may need to contact your email provider to reset it. Thunderbird only keeps the last password that you entered.
creator: davidsk

content:
If you downloaded the .tar.bz file from Mozilla open it and you'll find a directory called thunderbird. Put that wherever you please. Inside that is the executable itself, also called thunderbird.

Let's say you put the thunderbird directory straight in your home directory. To run it open a terminal any type ~/thunderbird/thunderbird. You could also find it in your graphical file browser and double-click it.

When you know it works you can make a custom launcher for it in the menu and/or on the panel, though how will depend on what distro and desktop environment you use.
creator: thepillenwerfer
